website_summaries.verdict: For students and professionals who ritually take, review, and share handwritten notes, the Echo smartpen does what all great technology should do: it makes life easier.
pros: The Livescribe Echo is a ballpoint pen and voice recorder combination that preserves digital copies of your notes and recordings, which can be replayed, saved to your computer, and shared with others
cons: pens and caps tend to get lost
ink cartridges are smaller than standard

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: These pens are crap. Within a short time the screen dies. Customer service will not exchange and they don’t do repairs. I cannot recommend this for anyone. Not for the money. The idea is great. Bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Rodsli

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love this pen! I tried the "Pulse" and didn't like that it relies on WIFI to function properly. The Echo Pen plugs right into your computer with a standard micro USB cable (which makes it easy if you have to replace it). The audio is great, I've recorded a ton of lectures, concerts, and even a few stand-up comedy shows. The best use by far is for Studying though. You can upload your notes and corresponding audio to your computer. and if you want, you can even convert your handwritten notes to text! amazing, especially considering that you can pay the same amount or more for a pen that does none of this!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Have One!
customer_reviews.text: I place the smart pen right there with the smart phone in terms of usefulness. I can think of so many professionals that could make great use of this device...anyone who attends meetings, meets with clients or customers, and anyone who reads for retention can make a great use of this device. This is a must have for students as well...it makes lecture notes and lectures themselves digital and searchable. Can't miss gift or purchase for oneself...if there were the ability to give it more stars, I would have rated it higher. There needs to be a "how to" book for device. Not because its difficult to use, but I believe its potential is only being scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sackett

customer_reviews.title: My new study buddy!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I got by without this. I haven't used the recording much but I am thrilled with the ability to take notes, upload them and have them be available on the pc and completely searchable. I love the size of the notebooks and am using them for reading notes, lecture notes, client interviews and keeping my journal. I like how I can use one notebook for all these different uses and just organize the saved pages into different folders on the pc instead of carrying separate books for different classes and a journal. I use Windows 7 and have had zero problems with either the hardware or software.
customer_reviews.author: Inga Thornell

customer_reviews.title: Still highly recommended for anyone that wants the convenience of a digital ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter to use in college and she found it invaluable. It is a pricey system to maintain as you have to purchase the manufacturers paper and pen refills. Still highly recommended for anyone that wants the convenience of a digital pen system.
customer_reviews.author: Yooperhunter

customer_reviews.title: These are worth their weight in gold, especially since ...
customer_reviews.text: These are worth their weight in gold, especially since they do NOT load to "the Cloud" - the material you record remains confidential and HIPAA compliant as long as you keep them passworded and encrypted on your computer. NB: The pen's recorded material must be stored on your C drive, and since these pens hold 8 GB, make sure you partition your drive big enough to have plenty of room for all you record.
customer_reviews.author: ObutiAMcalm

customer_reviews.title: functional but OLED display may fade away
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pen since 2010 without any problem. It is still going strong. In many respects, it is actual better than the new livescribe 3 pen which I also own. Update: The OLED display has faded and it becomes very hard to see if the pen is on or off. It might be a firmware issue. The display problem has made the pen basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingWings

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty great.
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty innovative, and works very well. I am surprised at how well it can make out my chicken scratch handwriting when I am attempting to keep up with instructors. I wish it had a smart tag function so you could easily subdivide notebooks by smart topics automatically but other then that it is pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, that good and Yes, that easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply, I couldn't believe it was so easy to get started and use it productively AND YES, it really is that good! After my first week using it, I feel my work quality has already improved through the completeness and speed that topics can be covered. Students or conference attendees should also get this product!!! Accessories you should consider: - "Livescribe AAA-00014 Echo 3D Recording Earbuds": Particularly for conferences etc., to improve audio quality. - "Livescribe Deluxe Carrying Case": a compact protective case to keep things protected and together. Expecting to boy one for my dad and another for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian R

customer_reviews.title: An awesome productivity tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the Echo and SKY models and decided to hold onto SKY because of the wifi connectivity/Evernote integration. Having used Echo in the past, I do not see any major differences between the two models except for the ones noted above. So far, I have had a great experience with the pen. I hope Livescribe could be quicker with the much awaited enhancements.

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: Its a great pen that really makes taking and sharing notes a lot easier. The only problem that I can find with it is that in order to change notebooks you must transfer all of the data from the note book that you were using onto your computer which can be annoying if you are rushing to a class and you don't have time to pull out your laptop, but for the most part this is a great pen with good sound quality.

customer_reviews.title: A real time saving tool
customer_reviews.text: The LiveScribe pen has been a great addition to my work flow. I spend a great deal of time on conference calls and in meetings - the ability to immediately send out my Notes is a time saver. And we have a weekly development meeting where the recording in combo with my Notes makes sure that none of us miss any points for feature changes.

customer_reviews.title: Product works, customer support does not.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use some of the functionality of my smartpen, the echo 8gb. It worked great, good sound, easy playback. I could not get it to connect to my computer. Customer service had me re-install the desktop software and drivers over and over..rebooting the pen, my machine, etc. That was seemingly their only recourse. The customer service agent sheepishly apologized, having exhausted his not very comprehensive playbook. When I asked if they would send me a new USB cable, they said it was not the cable - so I bought my own. Guess what it was? The USB cable. Very bush league.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but why bother the complication?
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent product, five stars. But if you are going to only record written notes, it is advantageous to use simple pen and paper and then just scan them to make them searchable. The pen is a little thick, especially if you have thin girly fingers =)

customer_reviews.title: Mac software bad, data can be corrupted
customer_reviews.text: The software is painfully slow and often crashes on Macs. PC is fine. What is worse is the data on my smartpen got corrupted (a "rare" issue) and so I lost three months of lecture notes. They are now unreadable on my computer after being corrupted on the pen, and I had to wipe the pen. It took two weeks of back and forth with Livescribe Support to get the pen and software working again. But the software remains annoyingly slow, and there is no guarantee that the pen will not get corrupted again.

product_meta.title: Livescribe 8 GB Echo Smartpen
product_meta.description:
Find what you need with a tap. The Echo smartpen from Livescribe records everything you hear, say and write, and links your audio recordings to your notes, so you can find what you need. Packed with useful features, the Echo Smartpen helps you put your notes to work, so they're always accessible. The Echo smartpen records everything you hear and write, so you can find what you need with a simple tap. Ideal for meetings, conferences, or classes, this compact tool is as easy to carry as traditional pen-and-paper, but smarter. Replay your recorded audio anytime, anywhere, with a quick tap on your notes. Save and Search Using the Livescribe Desktop, you can save notes to your computer, which makes it a snap to integrate them into a report or presentation. Search for specific words or phrases within all of your notebooks, organize them they way you want, and export them locally for backup or transfer. Send and Share - Its easy to share your notes or recordings publically or privately as a PDF, audio file, or a pencast. What's a pencast? A pencast is an interactive flash movie of your handwritten notes and audio. You can publish pencasts online, share them privately via email, or post them directly on Facebook. Applications: Customize your smartpen with downloadable apps -from dictionaries to translators, time savers, games and more. As new apps become available, your smartpen evolves with you. What You Get- The Echo smartpen; 8 GB of memory; Livescribe Desktop software for Mac or Windows (download); 500MB of personal online storage; Starter dot paper notebook; Micro USB Cable; Interactive Getting Started Guide; Smartpen Tips & Tricks Guide;2 smartpen caps 2 ink cartridges What You Need Windows XP with SP3 or Windows Vista or Windows 7. Intel-based Mac with Mac OS X 10.5.5 or later, including 10.6 600MHz CPU or higher 300 MB minimum free disk space USB 2.0 port Internet connection for software downloadThe Echo smartpen works only with Livescribe Dot Paper.

AMAZON.COM



Pencasts allow you to hear, see and relive notes exactly as they were captured


Easily send notes and audio to people and destinations



Take the stress out of tests and meetings with an Echo Smartpen from Livescribe. Record everything you hear, say and write, while linking your audio recordings to your notes. Quickly replay audio from your Livescribe paper, a computer, or a mobile device--all with a simple tap on your handwritten notes. It's never been easier to take notes and stay organized.

RECORD AND PLAY BACK
Smartpens record everything you write and hear so you'll never miss a word. Replay your meetings or lectures simply by tapping on your notes.

SAVE, SEARCH AND ORGANIZE
Livescribe Desktop saves your notes and recordings to your computer for fast, easy access to what's important. Search for words within your notes and find what you need fast.

SEND AND SHARE WITH LIVESCRIBE CONNECT
Easily send notes and audio to people and destinations such as Email, Google Docs, Facebook, Microsoft OneNote, Google Sites, MyLivescribe, your mobile device or your computer--all from your paper or Livescribe Desktop.



The Echo Smartpen is Livescribe's most powerful and easy to use Smartpen. View larger

8 GB OF MEMORY: MORE SPACE FOR RECORDINGS AND NOTES
When digitizing your notes and audio you'll need storage space; with 8 GB of memory, your Smartpen has it. An 8 GB Smartpen can hold over 800 hours of audio* or 128,000 pages of notes.

INCLUDED SMARTPEN APPLICATIONS
Your Echo Smartpen comes loaded with applications ready to work right out of the box:

Livescribe Connect Premium: Easily send and share notes and audio to Email, Google Docs, Facebook, Microsoft OneNote, Google Sites, MyLivescribe, your mobile device or your computer

Quick Record: record audio without using dot paper with just a press of a button

Quick Calc: Write an addition, subtraction, multiplication or division problem on dot paper and get the answer on your Smartpen screen

Launch Line: launch your favorite app by writing its name

 

Password: protect your recorded paper replay sessions with a 4-digit number

System Utilities: multiple language support, time, date, storage info, and battery charge





Dot paper allows a Smartpen to capture everything it writes

LIVESCRIBE DOT PAPER
Livescribe dot paper uses regular paper printed with a unique pattern of tiny microdots. This tiny pattern works a lot like a GPS system for your Smartpen. It allows a Smartpen to capture everything it writes or draws on dot paper.

Livescribe Smartpens only work with Livescribe Dot Paper, so there's a variety of dot paper sizes and types available: College-ruled Notebooks, Lined Journals, Blank Journals, Mini Journals, A5-sized Notebooks, Grid Notebooks, Flip Notepads, and Sticky Notes. You can even print your own dot paper for free from within Livescribe Desktop on many printers.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
Livescribe Echo Smartpen with 8 GB of memory, Livescribe Connect Premium (includes Connect Basic plus additional connectors for Email, Google Docs and Google Sites), Livescribe Desktop software for Mac or Windows, 500 MB of personal online storage, starter dot paper notebook, Micro USB cable, interactive Getting Started guide, Smartpen Tips and Tricks guide, 2 Smartpen caps, 2 ink cartridges.

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Windows XP 32-bit SP2 or higher, or Windows Vista 32 or 64-bit, or Windows 7
 * Intel Mac with Mac OS X 10.5.5 or higher
 * 600MHz CPU or higher
 * 300 MB minimum free disk space
 * Available USB 2.0 port
 * Livescribe Desktop 2.7 for Windows or Mac OS
 * Smartpen firmware version 2.7 or later
 * Internet connection

*Actual recording time varies by audio quality setting.
Livescribe paper required--don't record without permission
These connectors are available only with Livescribe Connect Premium
Mobile device access requires Pencast Player App or Flash-enabled web browser
